chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Michael R. Valente was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

records.addlTxt: 08:14 AM Defendant Michael R. Valente in court via Zoom video from Sand Ridge with attorney Martin J Lipske.  David V. Meany appeared in-person for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. State comments on Lutheran Soc Ser rec -- maybe has some objections or requests for clarifications -- asking court for a brief cross exam of plan. Attorney has no objection. Agree w/ plan. Ms. Pavolski from Lutheran Soc Serv, 8:18 sworn by Clerk, testimony given. 8:30 AM Attorney commenting on plan. State redirect. No other evidence. State comments on brief argument -- 90 day GPS monitor, impose curfew. Attorney's argument -- to approve treatment plan. Court comments on plan -- order GPS monitor to be placed for the first 90 days otherwise beyond that, adopt plan. Order to be submitted to Court from DA's office.
Letter to Janet Valente from E.Tribys, re:  ex parte communication

02:31 PM Defendant Michael R. Valente in court with attorney Martin J Lipske appearing by ZOOM.  Defendant Michael R. Valente in custody with Sandridge Correctional.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Report has been filed, State reviewed reports that have been filed. Atty has reviewed the reports that have been filed. Atty comments- joint agreement to accept the reports and report from Sandridge. State has no objections. State filed proposed EX and have them admitted. Ct will accept reports subject to any testimony. the State must show under 971.17(4) that the def still possess a risk. State calls Dr. Lundbohm, sworn, exam by the State. Ex 1 marked by the State, Atty makes objection. witness narrows time frame down. Cross exam by Atty. Redirect by the State. State moves to admit Ex 1. Ex 1 admitted. Ct questions witness. Atty questions witness in light of the courts questions. Witness is released. Atty calls witness, Dr. Black, Sworn, exam by Atty. Ex 2 is filed, (RL) Cross examine by State. Atty Redirects. No rebuttal. State gives brief argument. Requests proposal be denied. Atty gives brief argument. Asks cond. release be granted. Ct. makes comments. Burdon of proof is not clear and convincing.  Ct. not satisfied. Grant conditional release. Ct. Orders COC to provide plan of 60 days. Hearing scheduled for 4/4/22 @ 8:15 AM.
Def is set up to appear by Zoom from Sandridge on Jan 19;  they will dial into Judge's zoom;  ka
To Dr. James Black from Eleanora Tribys

Atty makes closing arugments asking for Ct to grant the conditional release. State makes closing arugments- hopes the Ct will not grant the conditional release. Atty makes final comments. 
Ct comments on hearing--
Ct finds- does pose a risk to the community, Req is denied.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael R. Valente in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. moved to amend count 1 to dismiss the enhancer of hate crime of arson. Ct 1 is now amended to delete the hate crime provision. now Count 1 arson of a building. Count 2 DRI. Client now withdraws plea of NG. Plea is now Not guilty due to mental disease. DA accepts plea. Ct is considering  the length of the sentence. Maximum confinement would be 25 years. DA comments got the 30 years with the enhancer. BAck on record. no agreement - in recess. Back on record. DA comments modification agreement State moves to dismiss to enhancer. Ct comments Charge amended to arson to a building as a hate crime. Understands charge and penalty. Ct can not countuine as just a plea on mental disease. Atty comments pleas G and couples that with mental illness. Def pleads G and not responsable  as mental disease . Count 2 is DRI. Signed PQ. no threat or force to admits this act. took pres and pres. Understand elements of the crime. Atty comment def admits criminal act was a hate crime. Wants court to accept pleas. Ct finds pleas know and vol given. know and vol waives rights. Ct accepts plea of G and Finds G. Ct finds time crime was committed Def did have mental disease . Ct finds not responsable  by reason  of mental disease . committed to mental health services. State complied with mental health. No Gun. and no body armor. Ct finds not competent  to refuse medications . medicine given even involuntary . Def is dangerous .  Appeals rights are undecided at this time. Credit for time served. credit for 367 days.
